parameters.content:
# Extracción Data Facturas

### - Transforma datos xml en binario base64
### - Extrae información tomando parámetros y elementos de la DIAN
### - Eror Handler --> archiva documento en carpeta error

       *- Posibles errores:* 
          *1. API Rate Limit 
          *2. Archivo corrupto.

### - Iteración entre los documentos en la carpeta

# Parametrización Cuentas Terceros

### - Para cada tercero parametriza las cuentas contales que se deben contemplar en la clasificación de las cuentas contables.
### - Descarta (Error) la factura si el tercero no tiene parametrización de cuentas.

# Descripción Factura y Cargue DB información factura.

### - Basado en los items del documento genera un breve resumen de la factura
### - Crea un listado "plano" de los items de la factura
### - Basado en el resumen y los items determina el tipo de gasto. Servicio, producto, activo e inventario.
### - Carga en DB únicamente información contenida en la factura

# Parametrización del Modelo

### - Cargue parámetros para el modelo AI y prompts
### - Listado facturas disponibles para procesar

## Error Handler 
Documento con el reporte de errores encontrados.

**Click to View** 
[Document - Error Log](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G618RMtrzF5pecMAvATctu5CLl6dpL-qdKNpWaXx0mI/edit?usp=sharing)

nodes.name: Invoice Data
nodes.notes: Prepara data de cada variable para utilizarla en nodos futuros. También organiza y consolida data para cargue a DB

nodes.name: Agregador DataXML
nodes.notes: Agregador Data XML de la factura en un output único

nodes.name: Agregador Items
nodes.notes: Agregador Items XML de la factura en un output único

nodes.name: Clean JSON

nodes.name: Data_XML_Invoice

nodes.name: Format_XMLInvoice_Data
nodes.notes: Prepara data factura para enviar a DB

json.Description: Invoice Data Extraction XML or PDF
json.UserPrompt_4:
# SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS
- Make sure not to duplicate values.
- Assign each variable the corresponding value. Use the variable name and XML element to extract data accurately.
- Ensure that ReteIVA is extracted only when cac:TaxScheme/ID:05 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:ReteIVA are present.
- Ensure that ReteFuente is extracted only when cac:TaxScheme/ID:06 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:ReteFuente or <cbc:Name>ReteRenta are present.
- Ensure ReteICA is extracted only when cac:TaxScheme/ID:07 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:ReteICA are present.
- ReteIVA is not the same as ReteFuente, ReteRenta, or ReteICA.
- ReteICA is not the same as ReteFuente, ReteRenta, or ReteIVA.
- ReteFuente and ReteRenta are the same and distinct from ReteICA or ReteIVA.
- ReteICA is not the same as ICA. Both are independent variables.
- ReteIVA is not the same as IVA. Both are independent variables.
- Ensure to leave the value empty if there is no match for the corresponding tax field.
json.SystemPrompt:
# ROL
You are an accountant with experience in Colombia, an expert in extracting data from invoices, and capable of reading and extracting data in both Spanish and English.
json.UserPrompt_1:
# TASK
Extract data from XML invoices. You will receive data from an XML text scrape of the invoice. Your task is to turn invoice data into structured fields: Parent Document ID, Issue Date, Sender Party Registration Name, Sender Party Company ID, Receiver Party Registration Name, Receiver Party Company ID, LineExtensionAmount, IVA, IC, ICA, INC, Rete IVA, Rete Fuente, Rete ICA, Tax Inclusive Amount, Payable Amount, Invoice Line, CUFE.

Each variable has a unique value, do not duplicate values, and ensure accurate field allocation.
json.UserPrompt_3:
# OUTPUT
Ensure that the output complies exactly with the JSON format and that all variables return a value extracted from the data given. If a value cannot be extracted, return an empty string for that field.

Return the result in JSON using this format:

{  
  "ParentDocumentID": "invoice id goes here. This is the invoice number or ID, it is not the file name. Avoid getting the file name",
  "IssueDate": "date when the invoice was issued",
  "SenderParty_RegistrationName": "vendor name goes here. This is the information of the party who issued the invoice",
  "SenderParty_CompanyID": "vendor tax ID goes here. This is the identification information of the party who issued the invoice",
  "ReceiverParty_RegistrationName": "customer name goes here. This is the information of the party who is receiving the invoice",
  "ReceiverParty_CompanyID": "customer tax ID goes here. This is the identification information of the party who is receiving the invoice",
  "LineExtensionAmount": "subtotal of the invoice. The value before taxes goes here",
  "TaxInclusiveAmount": "total taxable amount of the invoice. In Colombia, this includes the sales tax (IVA)",
  "IVA": "added sales value tax (IVA) in Colombia. The XML element and attribute is cac:TaxScheme/ID:01 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:IVA. Return the amount value, not the code value", 
  "IC": "consumption tax (Impuesto al Consumo) in Colombia. The XML element and attribute is cac:TaxScheme/ID:02 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:IC. Return the amount value, not the code value",
  "ICA": "industry and commerce tax (Impuesto de Industria, Comercio y Aviso) in Colombia. The XML element and attribute is cac:TaxScheme/ID:03 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:ICA. Return the amount value, not the code value",
  "INC": "national consumption tax (Impuesto Nacional al Consumo) in Colombia. The XML element and attribute is cac:TaxScheme/ID:04 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:INC. Return the amount value, not the code value",
  "ReteFuente": "ReteFuente = ReteRenta (Income Withholding). The XML element and attribute is cac:TaxScheme/ID:06 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:ReteFuente or <cbc:Name>ReteRenta</cbc:Name>. Ensure to return only the amount value, not the code value, and ensure no overlap with ReteIVA or ReteICA.",
  "ReteICA": "Withholding for the industry and commerce tax. The XML element and attribute is cac:TaxScheme/ID:07 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:ReteICA. Ensure to return only the amount value, not the code value, and ensure no overlap with ReteFuente or ReteIVA.",
  "ReteIVA": "Withholding for added sales value tax, Retención sobre el IVA in Colombia. The XML element and attribute is cac:TaxScheme/ID:05 and cac:TaxScheme/Name:ReteIVA. Ensure to return only the amount value, not the code value, and ensure no overlap with ReteFuente or ReteICA.",
  "PayableAmount": "total payable amount of the invoice",
  "InvoiceLine": "description of all invoice items, including description, quantities, unit value, and total value of each item. If multiple invoice lines exist, concatenate the descriptions, separated by semicolons",
  "CUFE": "CUFE is an alphanumeric ID for the invoice"  
}

Respond only in JSON. The first character must be “{” and the last character “}”. Do not output “```json” or any other sort of format.
json.Name: P1

json.SystemPrompt:
# ROL
You are an accountant with experience in Colombia, an expert in extracting data from invoices, and capable of reading and extracting data in both Spanish and English. You are an expert in "Plan Unico de Cuentas" (PUC) and in all accounting regulations.
json.UserPrompt_1:
# TASK
Read the invoice information presented in a JSON schema. Your job is to write a short description of the invoice. The description must be concrete, succinct, and clear. It should contain the necessary information to classify the invoice properly in an accounting record for each relevant accounting statement according to the PUC. Do not include any monetary or quantity values, only the invoice description.

The description must be in spanish. Use up to 150 characters. 

Do not include any information from SenderParty and ReceiverParty. Do not include word "Factura".

To write the desciption only use the information in "InvoiceLine"

Make sure to write a comprehensive and clear invoice description.
json.UserPrompt_3:
# OUTPUT
Ensure that the output complies exactly with the JSON format and that all variables return a value extracted from the data given. If a value cannot be extracted, return an empty string for that field. 

Return the result in JSON using this format: 

{ 
"InvoiceLineTxt": ”Text from key value InvoiceLine. Is a must to present the data in a single string. Do not output the data in any other format”, 
”Description”: ”Here goes the invoice Description. Do not include SenderParty_RegistrationName. No not include vendor name”,
"ExpenseType": "Here you have to indicate if the invoice corresponds to a Purchase of Goods, Services Received, Asset Purchase or Inventory. In the clasification only use the types Purchase of Goods, Services Received, Asset Purchase or Inventory. Review in detail InvoiceLine to make the classification"
} 

Respond only in JSON. The first character must be "{" and the last character "}". Do not output "```json" or any other sort of format. 

The output must be a valid JSON. And all key values must output as simple strings
json.UserPrompt_2:
# EXAMPLES
Output examples

### Example 1

{
  "InvoiceLineTxt": "Manzana Royal Gala, Manzana Verde, Mandarina Arrayana Kilo, Banano Urabá Kilo, Granadilla, Manzana Verde, Granadilla",
  "Description": "Compra de frutas variadas incluyendo manzanas, mandarinas, bananos y granadillas.",
  "ExpenseType": "Purchase of Goods"
}

### Example 2

{
  "InvoiceLineTxT": "POLIZA CUMPLIMIENTO 100036304 ANEXO 0, CERTIFICADO 97106840",
  "Description": "Póliza de cumplimiento relacionada con certificado.",
  "ExpenseType": "Services Received"
}
json.Name: P2

json.UserPrompt_4:
# SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS
- Output with extracted value only the identified and classified debit records.
- The output must be only the response in JSON. Do not include any additional information or explanation.
- Make sure to not repeat AccountNum8 in any other variable.
- Do not repeat accounts.
- Respond only in JSON. The first character must be `{` and the last character `}`. Do not output “```json” or any other sort of format.
- **Ensure that all values from `LineExtensionAmount`, `IVA`, `IC`, `ICA`, `INC`, `ReteIVA`, `ReteFuente`, `ReteICA` are allocated to the corresponding account.**
- Use the value from "Account_to_InvoiceData_[1-40]" to match invoice values with the corresponding account.
- If an exact match is not found, use context from `InvoiceDescription` or `ExpenseType` to classify.
json.SystemPrompt:
# ROL
You are an accountant with extensive experience in Colombia, specializing in extracting and processing data from invoices in both Spanish and English. You are an expert in “NIIF” and the “Plan Unico de Cuentas” (PUC), and are well-versed in all relevant accounting regulations and procedures in Colombian accounting.
json.UserPrompt_1:
# Task
Your task is to read the invoice information and make the corresponding accounting record for the invoice. Based on the PUC, assign the appropriate account numbers to register the invoice in the accounting books.

- Understand Invoice Description, Invoice Information, items included in InvoiceLine, and ExpenseType to accurately assign accounting accounts.
- Ensure all invoice values (LineExtensionAmount, IVA, IC, ICA, INC, ReteIVA, ReteFuente, ReteICA) are classified. Each value must be mapped to an appropriate PUC account.
- Include all necessary accounts to register the expenses or income, as well as taxes.
- For each account, specify whether it is a debit or a credit entry.
- Follow all Colombian accounting regulations and procedures meticulously.
- If a value cannot be directly mapped to an account from the provided PUC list, use context clues from InvoiceDescription and ExpenseType to classify it.
- If certain fields in the invoice data are empty or missing, indicate this by leaving the respective account values and descriptions as null.
json.UserPrompt_3:
# OUTPUT
Ensure that the output complies exactly with the JSON format and that all variables return a value extracted from the data given. If a value cannot be extracted, return an empty string for that field.

### JSON Output Structure:
{
  "AccountNum[number]": "Here goes the account number",
  "AccountNum[number]_Des": "Here goes the account description AccountNum[number]",
  "AccountNum[number]_Val": "Here goes the monetary value from AccountNum[number] taken from invoice data",
  "AccountNum[number]_Deb_Cred": "Here goes only the classification Debit or Credit",
  "AccountNum8": "Here goes the account number of the liability",
  "AccountNum8_Des": "Here goes the account description AccountNum8, a liability account",
  "AccountNum8_Val": "Value = 0",
  "AccountNum8_Deb_Cred": "Equal to Credit",
  "Confidence": "Write the confidence level of the job done. The confidence value goes from 0.0 to 1.0. For example, a level of 0.2 represents low confidence in the account classification, while 0.9 represents high confidence in the account classification"
}

- [number] should be an iteration from 1 to 7.
- AccountNum1. The first Account is a Purchase of Goods, Services Received, Asset Purchase, or Inventory. From that, classify the other accounts.
- AccountNum1. Is a number greater than 50000000.
- AccountNum8 is a number greater than 20000000 and lower than 23999999. Ensure the selected account number meets this criterion.
- AccountNum1 and AccountNum8 always have to return a value and must be different from 0, cannot be empty.
json.UserPrompt_2:

{

json.SystemPrompt:
# ROL
You are an accountant with experience in Colombia, an expert in extracting data from invoices, and capable of reading and extracting data in both Spanish and English. You are an expert in "Plan Unico de Cuentas" (PUC) and in all accounting regulations.
json.UserPrompt_1:
# TASK
Read the item description extracted from an invoice and classify the item into an "Expense Type" as either "Purchase of Goods" or "Services Received."

## Steps

1. Analyze the item description provided.
2. Determine if the item is a "Purchase of Goods" or "Services Received" based on the description.
3. Assign the "Expense Type" based on the classification.
json.UserPrompt_3:
# OUTPUT
Ensure that the output complies exactly with the JSON format and that all variables return a value extracted from the data given. If a value cannot be extracted, return an empty string for that field. 

Return the result in JSON using this format: 

{
"ExpenseType": "Here you have to indicate if the item corresponds to a Purchase of Goods or Services Received."
}


Respond only in JSON. The first character must be "{" and the last character "}". Do not output "```json" or any other sort of format. 

The output must be a valid JSON. And all key values must output as simple strings
json.Name: P9

json.SystemPrompt:
# ROL
You are an accountant with experience in Colombia, an expert in extracting data from invoices, and capable of reading and extracting data in both Spanish and English. You are an expert in Tax classification, you classify conditions to calculate tax withholding for "Retención en la Fuente" or "ReteFuente"
json.UserPrompt_1:
# TASK
Read the item description extracted from an invoice and classify the item into its corresponding "Type". Select one type from the list provided that match with the item description.

## Steps

1. Analyze the item description provided.
2. Assign the "Type" based on the classification from the list provided.
json.UserPrompt_3:
# OUTPUT
Ensure that the output complies exactly with the JSON format and that all variables return a value extracted from the data given. If a value cannot be extracted, return an empty string for that field. 

Return the result in JSON using this format: 

{
"Type": "Here you have to write the type that matches the item description. For the classification only use data provided in list "Type"
}


Respond only in JSON. The first character must be "{" and the last character "}". Do not output "```json" or any other sort of format. 

The output must be a valid JSON. And all key values must output as simple strings
json.Name: P10

json.SystemPrompt:
# ROL
You are an accountant with experience in Colombia, an expert in extracting data from invoices, and capable of reading and extracting data in both Spanish and English. You are an expert in Tax classification, and can classify conditions to calculate tax withholding for "Retención en la Fuente" or "ReteFuente"
json.UserPrompt_1:
# TASK
You will be provided with an item description extracted from an invoice, along with a category, type, and a list of tax concepts. 

Your task is to:
1. Analyze the item description.
2. Identify the closest match based on the description, category, and type from the provided "Concept List."
3. Based on the item description, classify the item into the corresponding "CONCEPT" value and assign the corresponding "NUM" value. You can only use "CONCEPT" and "NUM" values from the "Concept List" provided.

Always return a classification, selecting the most relevant option from the provided "Concept List."
json.UserPrompt_3:
# OUTPUT
Return the result in JSON format using the following structure:

```json
{
    "NUM": "The number of the closest matching concept from the 'Concept List'",
    "CONCEPT": "The concept that best matches the item description from the 'Concept List'"
}


Respond only in JSON. The first character must be "{" and the last character "}". Do not output "```json" or any other sort of format. 

The output must be a valid JSON. And all key values must output as simple strings

"NUM" return the value as a valid number
"NUM" and "CONCEPT" Can not be empty, always return value
json.Name: P12
